poem:
"Home in a Manchester Close"

At cul-de-sac's end, 
a white door blooms hope, 
a fortress in red brick and quiet breaths, 
Championed by Eritreans, Mariam and Helen,
strong hearts united under a familiar moon,
Manchester to them, 
a sonnet of new beginnings.
Redemption whispers in charity's hands,
'Nobody can disturb us here,' 
a chorus sung in life's intricate symphony. 
They, the newest roots in this city's weave,
are Home.
